cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles southwest of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn west-northwest Monday, curve northwest Tuesday, and then accelerate northeast across the Florida Big Bend toward the southeast United States coast.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, northern Florida Peninsula, and coastal Georgia-Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Low (17% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Thursday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the east-central Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–4 inches of rain possible Wednesday–Thursday, producing brief localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous small-craft conditions offshore beginning mid-week
